pullRequest.body:
Mark theorems pertaining to `AnalyticAt` / `MeromorphicAt` for use with `fun_prop`. As discussed yesterday in the FLUG meeting with @TwoFX and others, I duplicated a several theorems because tactics such as `fun_prop` and `rw` cannot see that `f + g` and `fun x => f x + g x` are the same thing. I made the formulations a little more consistent, in that there is now always one theorem `AnalyticAt.add` that speaks about `f + g` and one version `AnalyticAt.add'` that speaks about `fun x => f x + g x`.

This new functionality is used in [Project VD](https://github.com/kebekus/ProjectVD), which aims to formalize Value Distribution Theory for meromorphic functions on the complex plane.

---

Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [08b2a693a4](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21057/commits/08b2a693a4c78a395a0c5167993de786d0caee66)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ AnalyticAt.add'`
`+ AnalyticAt.cexp'`
`+ AnalyticAt.comp'`
`+ AnalyticAt.comp_of_eq'`
`+ AnalyticAt.const_smul'`
`+ AnalyticAt.div'`
`+ AnalyticAt.inv'`
`+ AnalyticAt.mul'`
`+ AnalyticAt.neg'`
`+ AnalyticAt.rexp'`
`+ AnalyticAt.smul'`
`+ AnalyticAt.sub'`
`+ add'`
`+ div'`
`+ inv'`
`+ mul'`
`+ neg'`
`+ order_mul`
`+ order_mul_of_order_eq_top`
`+ order_pow`
`+ pow'`
`+ smul'`
`+ sub'`
`+ zpow'`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
@sgouezel Thanks for looking at this --in record time-- on a Saturday evening!

:v: kebekus can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

@sgouezel Thanks again!

bors r+

bors d+
Thanks!
Looks good to me, thanks!

bors d+
Thanks!

```suggestion
```
This one shouldn't be marked, because `fun_prop` will never be able to provide the auxiliary hypothesis unless it is trivial. In this case, the versions above will apply.
Roger. Thanks for pointing that out.

```suggestion
```
Ditto

```suggestion
    (hf : AnalyticAt 𝕜 f x) : AnalyticAt 𝕜 (fun z ↦ g (f z)) x :=
  hg.comp hf
```

```suggestion
```
No empty line inside proofs.

```suggestion
    (hf.pow n).order = n • hf.order := by
```
As discussed on Zulip, this formulation is better for meromorphic functions. For coherence, I think it's good to use the same formulation also for holomorphic functions.
Roger.

```suggestion
lemma inv' {f : 𝕜 → 𝕜} {x : 𝕜} (hf : MeromorphicAt f x) : MeromorphicAt (fun z ↦ (f z)⁻¹) x :=
```
I'd exchange the primed and non-primed version, for coherence with the other formulations in the PR.
Args. Fixed according to your suggestion.
I think this one and the next one shouldn't be tagged either, because there's no way fun_prop will  find that the derivative is invertible.
Roger. Remove the fun_prop as requested.

pullRequest.title: feat: mark AnalyticAt / MeromorphicAt for use with fun_prop
